proposition: The death penalty deters crime more than life imprisonment

Life imprisonment, on the other hand, simply does not have the same deterrent effect. Criminals know that even if they are caught and convicted, they will still be allowed to live out their days, albeit behind bars. This is not enough to make them reconsider their actions.

While some argue that the death penalty is barbaric or inhumane, I would argue that allowing brutal murderers to continue living is the real injustice. The death penalty is a necessary tool to deter the most serious crimes and protect public safety. The data backs this up.
